> So what is this worldview and 'religion' called? 

The first thing that came to my mind is that you're a modern, humanist, curious and spiritual person (you speak of qualia(s) and the mind being something akin to math, very real yet very abstract which are 2 points a person leaning towards materialism which doesn't believe in the "soul" or the "mind" would dismiss, you speak of liking the community aspects of life and religion much, like humanists, you speak of transhumanism which is a very recent and modern philosophical theme) but I don't think there a "definite" or single name for your beliefs, we're all a mixed bags of beliefs after all and our life experiences are shaping them, one day, one question and one answer at a time.

> We have an origin, we have a cause, we have a purpose. Survive, thrive, evolve, improve, enhance.

Indeed, as the stoics said, we have to "live by our nature", it's the only way according to them, this includes a lot of "common sense"

I think you would enjoy the Crash Course Philosophy video series, very thoughtful videos (clearnet) : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1A_CAkYt3GY&list=PL8dPuuaLjXtNgK6MZucdYldNkMybYIHKR

I wish I would have time for a bigger post but I'm a bit in a rush right now, maybe I'll post later some more thoughts after reading at ease :)
